Replace.Text: [COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_CIVIC_MERCANTILISM_DESCRIPTION]Camp improvements receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production and +1 [ICON_Food] Food.[NEWLINE]Lumber Mills can be built on Rainforest.[NEWLINE]Grants the ability to see the amounts of all of the resources in the world.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_CORPORATION_BUILDING_DISCOUNT_DESCRIPTION][NEWLINE]+60% [ICON_Production] Production toward Buildings in host city.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_CORPORATION_CIVILIAN_UNIT_DISCOUNT_DESCRIPTION][NEWLINE]+60% [ICON_Production] Production toward civilian units in host city.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_CORPORATION_MILITARY_UNIT_DISCOUNT_DESCRIPTION][NEWLINE]+60% [ICON_Production] Production toward military units in host city.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_GREATWORK_PRODUCT_TURTLES_5_NAME]Lord McConnell's Decidedly Not Mock Turtle Soup

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_IMPROVEMENT_CORPORATION_DESCRIPTION]A corporation dedicated to a specific Luxury Resource. Allows cities to create Products, a new type of Great Work which grants powerful bonuses to your cities that house them.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_IMPROVEMENT_CORPORATION_EXPANSION2_DESCRIPTION]A corporation dedicated to a specific Luxury Resource. Allows cities to create Products, a new type of Great Work which grants powerful bonuses to your cities that house them. Can only be pillaged (never destroyed) by natural disasters.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_IMPROVEMENT_INDUSTRY_DESCRIPTION]An industry dedicated to a specific Luxury Resource. Provides a unique benefit to its city, as well as +1 [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant point.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_INDUSTRY_BUILDING_DISCOUNT_DESCRIPTION][NEWLINE]+30% [ICON_Production] Production toward Buildings in host city.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_INDUSTRY_CIVILIAN_UNIT_DISCOUNT_DESCRIPTION][NEWLINE]+30% [ICON_Production] Production toward civilian units in host city.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_INDUSTRY_MILITARY_UNIT_DISCOUNT_DESCRIPTION][NEWLINE]+30% [ICON_Production] Production toward military units in host city.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_MOMENT_FIRST_CORPORATION_IN_WORLD_DESCRIPTION]Money made conceptual flesh – the world sees the establishment of its first Corporation! Time to take out the competition.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_MOMENT_FIRST_CORPORATION_IN_WORLD_INSTANCE_DESCRIPTION]A body without flesh – the first Corporation in the world appears in your civilization. Crates of {ResourceType} are ready to be branded, boxed and shipped!

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_MOMENT_FIRST_CORPORATION_INSTANCE_DESCRIPTION]Products require management, oversight, marketing, branding… a Corporation. Time to take out the competition!
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_MOMENT_FIRST_INDUSTRY_IN_WORLD_DESCRIPTION]The first Industry in the world has been created.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_MOMENT_FIRST_INDUSTRY_IN_WORLD_INSTANCE_DESCRIPTION]The gears of rationalized production turn first in the world in your Industry, churning out goods faster and more efficiently than before.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_MOMENT_FIRST_INDUSTRY_INSTANCE_DESCRIPTION] Start the assembly line! Refining, systematizing, streamlining production, you have established an Industry!
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_MOMENT_FIRST_LUXURY_RESOURCE_MONOPOLY_IN_WORLD]First Luxury Resource Monopoly in the World

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_MOMENT_FIRST_LUXURY_RESOURCE_MONOPOLY_IN_WORLD_DESCRIPTION]You are the first civilization in the history of the world to control a monopoly over a luxury resource!

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_MOMENT_FIRST_LUXURY_RESOURCE_MONOPOLY_IN_WORLD_INSTANCE_DESCRIPTION] The market on {ResourceType} has been cornered… by you, the first such monopoly in the world. Yours is the supply, let the demand come!

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_MOMENT_FIRST_LUXURY_RESOURCE_MONOPOLY_INSTANCE_DESCRIPTION]You control a monopoly over {ResourceType} - now, whoever wants some will have to go through you. Next step: profit!

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_NOTIFICATION_CORPORATION_LOST_SUMMARY]{1_CivName} has gained a controlling interest on the {2_ResourceIcon} {3_Resource} resource and founded a new Corporation, putting {4_CorpName} out of business!

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_NOTIFICATION_CORPORATION_OPPORTUNITY_SUMMARY]You now control {1_Amount} of the {2_ResourceIcon} {3_Resource} resource. This grants you the opportunity to create a Corporation with the ability to create Products from that resource.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_NOTIFICATION_CORPORATION_OPPORTUNITY_TAKEOVER_SUMMARY]You now hold a majority control of the {1_ResourceIcon} {2_Resource} resource. You now have the opportunity to create a new Corporation, putting the previous one out of business.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_NOTIFICATION_INDUSTRY_OPPORTUNITY_SUMMARY]Now that you have improved {1_num} {2_ResourceIcon} {3_Resource} resources, you have the opportunity to create an Industry around them.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_NOTIFICATION_PRODUCT_CREATED_SUMMARY]The new [ICON_GreatWork_Product] Product {1_ProductName} has been introduced to the public via the {2_BuildingName} in {3_CityName}.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_CONCEPTS_PAGE_MONOPOLIES_CHAPTER_CORPORATIONS_PARA_1]After researching Economics, and after securing at least three instances of the same Luxury resource and establishing an Industry, it’s time to found a Corporation. These require a Great Merchant instead of a Builder to create, and the Great Merchant is retired once the Corporation is created. Corporations can only be built on top of Industry improvements. Corporations grant double the Industry bonus for the appropriate resource to their home city. You can name your Corporation whatever you like, or use the automated name generator!

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_CONCEPTS_PAGE_MONOPOLIES_CHAPTER_CORPORATIONS_PARA_2]There can only be one Corporation for each Luxury resource in the world, but Corporations can be put 'out of business' if an opposing player manages to control more instances of the resource than the owning player. Once an opponent secures a controlling interest in another Corporation's resource, they can form their own Corporation around it, and the original owner's Corporation is removed.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_CONCEPTS_PAGE_MONOPOLIES_CHAPTER_INDUSTRIES_PARA_1]Once a civilization has improved two of the same type of Luxury resource and has completed the Currency technology they have the opportunity to establish an Industry around that resource. Resources owned by city-states also count toward this requirement if the player is suzerain of the city-state. This is done by using a Builder’s charge on top of an existing Improvement on any one of the Luxury resources. Only one Industry is allowed in a city at a time.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_CONCEPTS_PAGE_MONOPOLIES_CHAPTER_INDUSTRIES_PARA_2]In addition to providing Great Merchant points, Industries grant particular bonuses to their city based on the type of resource they improve:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Amber: +25% [ICON_Faith] Faith yield.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Citrus: +30% [ICON_Production] Production toward military units.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Cocoa: +20% Growth and +3 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Coffee: +20% [ICON_Culture] Culture yield.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Cotton: +30% [ICON_Production] Production toward military units.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Diamonds: +25% [ICON_Gold] Gold yield.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Dyes: +25% [ICON_Faith] Faith yield.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Furs: +30% [ICON_Production] Production toward civilian units.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Gypsum: +30% [ICON_Production] Production toward buildings.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Honey: +20% Growth and +3 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Incense: +25% [ICON_Faith] Faith yield.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Ivory: +30% [ICON_Production] Production toward military units.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Jade: +25% [ICON_Gold] Gold yield.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Marble: +30% [ICON_Production] Production toward buildings.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Mercury: +15% [ICON_Science] Science yield.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Olives: +30% [ICON_Production] Production toward civilian units.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Pearls: +25% [ICON_Faith] Faith yield.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Salt: +20% Growth and +3 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Silk: +20% [ICON_Culture] Culture yield.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Silver: +25% [ICON_Gold] Gold yield.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Spices: +20% [ICON_Culture] Culture yield.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Sugar: +20% Growth and +3 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Tea: +15% [ICON_Science] Science yield.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Tobacco: +30% [ICON_Production] Production toward military units.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Truffles: +25% [ICON_Gold] Gold yield.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Turtles: +15% [ICON_Science] Science yield.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Whales: +30% [ICON_Production] Production toward military units.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Wine: +20% [ICON_Culture] Culture yield.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_CONCEPTS_PAGE_MONOPOLIES_CHAPTER_MONOPOLIES_PARA_1]Capitalism might thrive on free trade, but savvy merchants know how to squeeze out their competitors. Controlling 60% or more of the world instances of a Luxury resource grants you a Monopoly on that Luxury. Each monopoly gives [ICON_Tourism] Tourism to the owning player, based on the number of resources controlled, multiplied by the number of foreign civilizations that do not control an instance of the monopolized resource. Monopolies also provide a [ICON_Gold] Gold yield per turn, beginning at +5 for controlling the bare minimum but rising to +10 at 75%, and +25 for controlling all instances. Additional +5 [ICON_GOld] Gold per turn is awarded for each major civilization the Monopoly holder is currently trading with. Once you research Mercantilism, you will be able to see the total number of Luxury resources in the world, as well as what percentage each player currently controls. You can control multiple Monopolies, but that seems a little cruel, doesn’t it?

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_CONCEPTS_PAGE_MONOPOLIES_CHAPTER_PRODUCTS_PARA_1]Once you’ve established a Corporation around a specific luxury resource, you can make a unique Product – a brand. These are similar to Great Works, but instead of being housed in museums, they are stored in new Great Work slots in Stock Exchange or Seaport buildings. Once placed, Products provide the benefits of an Industry, giving whatever bonus their original Luxury resource provided to their new city. You can move your Product to any city you like with the appropriate Great Work slot.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_CONCEPTS_PAGE_MONOPOLIES_CHAPTER_WELCOME_PARA_1]You enjoy your luxuries, but maybe it’s time to mobilize them for profit. The Monopolies and Corporations mode enables you to build Industries around Luxury resources, which give particular bonuses depending on the resource, found Corporations to improve those yields, manufacture unique Products – brands that act as economic Great Works, and, finally, secure a Monopoly. This Mode is one that is significant in all time periods, but really gets going in the later game.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_IMPROVEMENTS_PAGE_IMPROVEMENT_CORPORATION_CHAPTER_HISTORY_PARA_1]Edward, Lord Thurlow, is popularly quoted as saying, “Corporations have neither bodies to be punished, nor souls to be condemned, they therefore do as they like.” The modern-day corporation traces its lineage back to the great trading companies of the 16th-19th century. Facing the uncertainty of transcontinental oceanic trade, something greater needed to be made to outlast the possible death of both ship and owner. The trading companies reshaped the world – goods flowed around the world, but in the end, these companies were also victims of their own riches; global instability rose (in part owing to the action of the trading companies) making trade routes riskier, costs rose along with corruption and mismanagement, and eventually their home empires took over and colonialism moved to a more direct and invasive form. But the model of the corporation, and its utility in creating an artificial, imaginary, legal body that separates individuals from potential risk - and liability - remains with us.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_IMPROVEMENTS_PAGE_IMPROVEMENT_INDUSTRY_CHAPTER_HISTORY_PARA_1]The term “industry” often calls to mind the Industrial Revolution, with factories filled with steam, and dangerous, whirring machines. But long before the growth of what William Blake called “dark satanic mills”, rulers saw the advantage in bringing people together to intensify their labor. In Classical antiquity as well as beyond, those working in such industries were often those without their own property – most significantly serfs or enslaved peoples (though the workshops surrounding the Egyptian pyramids, contrary to the popular narrative, were worked by wage laborers). As feudalism gave way to the guild system, and then to early modern capitalism, private individuals gained enough money and status to open their own industries, and the stage was set for the history of economics to begin.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PLAYER_YIELD_GOLD_FROM_MONOPOLIES]{Value : number +#.#;-#.#} from monopolies on Luxury resources.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PROJECT_CORPORATION_PRODUCT_EFFECT_DESCRIPTION]New Products are sold in the Stock Exchange and Seaport buildings.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TUTORIAL_CORPORATION_OPPORTUNITY_A]Now that we hold a monopoly of the {1_ResourceIcon} {2_Resource} resource, we can upgrade that Industry into a Corporation. This allows us to create Products that can be spread to other Civilizations.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TUTORIAL_CORPORATION_OPPORTUNITY_B]We now have the ability to form Corporations on top of Luxury resources in our territory. Corporations can be created once we control a monopoly of a Luxury. Once established, Corporations can then create Products that can be spread to other Civilizations.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TUTORIAL_FIRST_TIME_MONOPOLIES]Turn your battlefields into marketplaces! With Monopolies and Corporations Mode enabled, controlling and improving Luxury resources provides new benefits. Start first by establishing Industries around the resources in your territory. Reap the monetary benefits of holding a monopoly on a Luxury resource by owning an overwhelming majority of its production in the world. Once you have a monopoly, form powerful Corporations to spread your influence to other civilizations. World dominance isn’t always achieved by the sword!

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TUTORIAL_INDUSTRY_INTRO]If we improve a second {1_ResourceIcon} {2_Resource} resource we will control enough to create an Industry around it! Industries benefit the city in which they are built by providing substantial production discounts or additional yields.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TUTORIAL_INDUSTRY_OPPORTUNITY_A]Now that we have improved a second {1_ResourceIcon} {2_Resource} resource, we can create an Industry, if we order one of our Builders to construct one there.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TUTORIAL_INDUSTRY_OPPORTUNITY_B]Our newfound knowledge of Currency has given us a better means of exchange. We now have the ability to create Industries on top of improved Luxury resources. Industries can be created once we have improved more than one of the same Luxury in our territory.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_UNIT_ESTABLISH_INDUSTRY_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES]Must control {1_NumResources} or more of the same Luxury resource.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_UNIT_FOUND_CORPORATION_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES]Must control at least 75% of the same Luxury resources in the world.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_WORLD_RANKINGS_TOURISM_FROM_RESOURCE_MONOPOLIES]{1_Tooltip}[NEWLINE]Overall [ICON_Tourism] Tourism Boosted +{2_Percent}% from Luxury Resource Monopolies
